body.name: Coleman Tabletop 2-in-1 Camping Grill/Stove, 2-Burner Propane Grill & Stove For Outdoor Cooking With Adjustable Burners & Pressure Regulator, 20,000 BTU's of Power for Camping, Tailgating, Grilling
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 47 mins
FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 3 hrs 47 mins
features: 2-IN-1 DESIGN: Use grill and stove at the same time; 130 sq. in. grilling area; stove fits a 10 in. pan
COOKING POWER: Up to 20,000 total BTUs
PRESSURE REGULATOR: Pressure-control technology provides consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
PERFECTHEAT TECHNOLOGY: Offers more efficient cooking with less fuel
4 ADJUSTABLE BURNERS: For precise temperature control
This product contains Aluminum and PTFE
body.description: Unleash your cooking potential with the 2-in-1 Coleman Tabletop Propane Camping Grill/Stove. Its versatile design lets you grill and stove at the same time, making it perfect for camping trips, tailgating or any other outdoor adventures. With up to 20,000 total BTUs, it offers powerful and consistent performance even in extreme conditions, and its PerfectHeat technology ensures more efficient cooking with less fuel. Boasting 2 adjustable burners, it allows for precise temperature control enabling you to sauté veggies whilst grilling chicken simultaneously. All these features are packed into one compact design that sets up easily wherever your culinary journey takes you.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Product Highlights Adjustable Burners A rotating dial lets you control burners for precise temperature control. PerfectFlow Pressure Control Pressure control technology keeps the heat steady for consistent performance, even in cold weather, high altitudes, or when fuel is low. WindBlock Side Panels Side panels shield burners from wind, can be adjusted to fit larger pans, and fold down for use as side tables on calmer days.

PerfectHeat Technology It facilitates a more complete fuel combustion process, delivering more effective cooking heat to your food with less fuel. Removable Drip Tray A grease tray collects the grease drippings from cooking and is removable for mess-proof disposal. Heavy-Duty Clasp It securely latches lid closed for safe and easy transport.
About the brand? Coleman helps people make fun memories by providing the lighting, stoves, coolers, tents, sleeping bags, and camping tools integral to their favorite outdoor experiences.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very good grill stovetop combo.Easy to setup and use. Easy to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Versatile, powerful, compact and functional
reviews.reviewText: This camping stove is really cool. On the left, you have a traditional stove burner that will heat up a small pot, pan or skillet. The manual recommends a 10" vessel as the maximum size. On the right is the grill. Unlike the other Coleman stove with two burners, this one comes with feet that can be attached temporarily, or screwed on for a more permanent arrangement. The feet elevate the stove above the surface of whatever it's sitting on. This allows a small grease tray to be fitted under the grease drain hole in the grill.It cooks quickly, so keep in mind that you will need to be pretty attentive to whatever you're grilling. This is not going to be a "low and slow" cooking method. The grill is designed to be compact for camping, so the heat source is very close to the griddle. Don't burn your weenies! Attached is a photo of both the burner and the grill in action. Overall I was very pleased with the performance of this item and would definitely recommend it. We actually own both the more common Coleman 2-burner stove and this one, so when camping we can cook on three pots/pans/skillets and a grill all at once. Camping is not an excuse for poor food. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars OverAll one of the Best Camping Grill
reviews.reviewText: I had previous camping Grill stove from different manufacturer, that doesn't work as good as coleman i have replaced them with this new Coleman grill it works perfectly fine. I really like this 2-in 1 option of grill and stove it really helps !! i would recommend this with my friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must buy for camping
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. For just a couple of people this grille seems perfect, it gets very hot and searing should not be a problem, I have not actually used it but did a burn in on it for 15 mins to burn off any residue left inside. Takes up very little space storing in the RV... I placed a pan of water on the burner and it was boiling in no time. I think it will be a keeper and will update this when I use itUpdate.... I am camping now and this grill is wonderful... on the lowest setting it will sear a steak and grilled chicken breast is wonderful... it is perfect size for 4 people... the side burner percolates coffee fast... this grill gets very hot so watch the food closely.. I put a sheet of foil under the heating element for fast cleanup... takes very little room... you have everything you want in a grill Compact and gets very hotOk I don't know how long I had this thing but I used it about 10 times and then the flame started acting weird... The grill would work but if you turned on the burner the flame would go real low... Guess it was a regulator went bad or something, anyway , I trashed it and I am now in the market for a more reliable one. Your results may vary, I loved the design but it just didn't last for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must have for all outdoor enthusiasts
reviews.reviewText: I have not been paid or been given anything to write this review, this comes from me!I wanted to let all who read this know that if you have not used or owned any of the Coleman line cooking products, you are missing out. I have used their products since I was a little boy hunting and fishing with my father and grandfather.I bought this style while living in CO. and have used it in more places than I can mention, camping just below tree line at tree line (13000 ft.) while elk hunting, fishing the Flaming Gorge in Utah, riding through the desert jeep trails of Moab, taking it on my raft for week or more long floats down the CO river starting at Pump House, camping in Yellowstone and even cooking in site view of Mt Rushmore. I took this thing around the country many times. It will keep working through snow storms, light rain falls, (you won’t be grilling in a down pour!) pretty much anything nature has to throw at it. It has been flipped, kicked, submerged, ETC… I literally abused it for years. We have now moved to HI and left most of my gear in storage. I had to purchase this again so we can BBQ on the Black Sand Beach in Hana, and when taking my son hunting on Lanai for axis deer, so we can cook the strap and he can get the real taste for freshly grilled meat. We just used it to make breakfast up on Haleakala watching the sunrise a couple of days ago. This is also the perfect thing to have for emergencies, we all know they happen, form power outages, hurricanes, blizzards, and many other natural disasters. Shipping was on point, living on Maui that is not always the case. The site said a day and between certain times. It was at my front door exactly as promised! When taking it out of the box it is as shiny as a brand new car. Now, I am a father, a chef, and a more than average outdoorsman, so cooking and participating in all outdoor activities with my family is a very big part of my life as you may be able to tell in reading this. If you can’t count on your gear when you are out miles away from anything and anyone, you are up the creek without a paddle per say. Having this item and knowing the Coleman line, I can honestly say that I do not worry about it what so ever! Do yourself a favor, if you like the outdoors and are out as much as we are and you like to cook your catch the way that it should be, then buy this. Thank you Coleman for making your products reliable and something that I can trust always working!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars New Camping Grill
reviews.reviewText: Nice grill, easy to assemble. I haven't used it yet, but I think it will be just fine. Just went through the hurricane in Florida and decided to purchase a cooking outdoor grill. One burner is 14,000 BTU and the other burner is 20,000 so if you purchase one and see both BTU's on each side of the box, that is why is there are two burners..

reviews.reviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for.
reviews.reviewText: This is what we wanted for our camper, it's compact, doesn't use much space. Great product

Nice little grill stove combo, I think Coleman is spot on with this product...Recently got back from a 2 week overlanding trip thru the Yukon and down the west coast of B.C. and the grill stove was my only cooking appliance aside from fire pits at campgrounds.During the trip I used it to grill steaks and chop’s, fry potatoes and make toast, boil water and fry bannock... the side burner is very typical of a Coleman burner where it takes a gentle steady hand to get a low simmer from the control knob, the grill side is much easier to regulate temperature but partially due to it being at times marginal to produce “enough” heat... don’t get me wrong it does a great job cooking steaks and burgers but if you want a nice sear make sure you pre-heat the grill for a bit... it’s not a typical patio BBQ with BTU’s to spare.Cleaning is not the most convienient feature of this grill but it is manageable with some practice.I did use a large aluminum frying pan on the grill side of the stove many many times and dident have any trouble however I wouldn’t put a cast iron pan on it and you need to watch how hot it’s getting closely to avoid melting the grill.

I liked it so much for many things; it’s very light, it’s not taking a space at all, easy to clean and it’s heating wellOnly two drawbacks, firstly, it doesn’t leave a space when the cover is closed to leave stuff to be cooked.Secondly, this version needs a lighter; a source of fire as it’s not self-igniting like the + version. Watch for that if it concerns you.Overall, I like it and recommend it for sure
Easy to put together, sturdy yet lightweight. Nice large surface, will be great for the upcoming camping season. Highly recommend.

Love it, very convenient and works great! Went to the beach last weekend and it fed 18 people!!! I actually bought mine from a different store and then ended up ordering one from Amazon for a friend. I would recommend using foil underneath the burner to keep it clean, when finished using it, you can simply remove the foil and toss it. Make sure to cut a hole for the grease to drain. Anytime we go out for a picnic, we bring it with us instead of using the ones at the park. Often people at the park stop by and ask where we bought it from!
